comment.body:
Oh no! D:

How did you join red?
oh... your blue hub circle is red...
I can see both of your posts again...
p2p: I noted some errors under that post, which might help nofish if you could recover them
That hub's name is very misleading. :(
I only see the hubs on ZeroHello.
That episode was incredibly strange.

GNU doesn't have intentional malware.  There are too many people looking at the code for something really malicious to be sneaked in.  However, open source projects have had some disastrous security flaws which allowed network exploits; look up Heartbleed, Shellshock, and Stagefright.
I'd like to see these in the ZeroHello newsfeed.
Controversial... more ways to respond to a post would be nice.  Sometimes "like" isn't really appropriate.

@ZAlex: sorry :(

You could increase the site size in the sidebar.  It should update normally then.
There's another: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Nvy3xR9hzqnTy4CimTVj8YuVVBFHAF578
ZeroLimit(s) was announced here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1N5Rs6CHsGPdDB1y3JqjYm9SLSWUTkjwEF
Since torcache went offline with KAT, you could get .torrent downloads working again by linking to itorrents.org instead.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GKFwRvtkY1gcbMxm9vuZnz3THfnUP9zz/ works in Chrome but not Firefox.  Would a hybrid work in both, or neither?
@PaintNinja: it just plays from a local file (hosted on some other site).
ogg works too: http://127.0.0.1:43110/15F9LYs6c17NUXv3MxpJSGbpWxyHTEbzMk/stream/audio.html?audioFile=magnet:?xt=urn:btih:1d003d7cbfa72c2a0ccf471f28392dc70c0e828f&tr=wss%3A%2F%2Ftracker.webtorrent.io

This mp3 causes most of the player to disappear: http://127.0.0.1:43110/15F9LYs6c17NUXv3MxpJSGbpWxyHTEbzMk/stream/audio.html?audioFile=magnet:?xt=urn:btih:17b33482dd66cbc65b5a40682f3aac075e38b5cf&tr=wss%3A%2F%2Ftracker.webtorrent.io
@Musickiller: in ZeroTalk also, old topics are sometimes overwritten.  The correct sequence number must be getting lost somewhere.
@Nobite: webtorrent made their own incompatible protocol... so everyone has to use a client that knows what webtorrent is.
@megfault: it does use the same data, but most torrent clients can't communicate with webtorrent clients.

Did you know your player supports wav?

http://127.0.0.1:43110/15F9LYs6c17NUXv3MxpJSGbpWxyHTEbzMk/stream/audio.html?audioFile=magnet:?xt=urn:btih:9f585bd5667fbb2651a3ae3e7f60ae234466b6c2&dn=01+The+Universe+Fights+Back.wav&tr=wss%3A%2F%2Ftracker.webtorrent.io
I think @nofish plans to add categories.  Priorities and better organization for ZeroHello would make it more practical to seed many sites.
Someone started to mirror The Intercept, but never finished uploading.  Maybe ZeroNet could get some recognition there.
@Nofish: I think that would be enough for most people.  The ZeroHello search has the same limitation.

Have you seen these?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/192dZ1EG5tU7PnCfuwGMDEBrr2eLqvs4t3/?Category:books
http://127.0.0.1:43110/15rm8ew4pamdiFmpyYwzmEqJVx6Etnv8pP/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/13NS3rSzCTpAYtH997rphfZDaWRypyjwnU/

@Nobite: it has a Hackers/Fight Club theme which is a little implausible, but it's produced well.  The episode titles are amusingly written in 1337 as if they were video filenames.  In the second season, I think they're running out of file extensions.
Where are they?
You answered me before I asked.  o_O
@Talnicrom: I can see messages from @theterminator and @reginageorge in the activity feed, but not in the main feed.
Which hub are they posting comments to?
